text: last week we decided to go and surprise
my brother who lives in New Jersey and
we knew that there were these
restrictions but we were not sure when
it was going to become effective that's
why we contacted the US Embassy in
Tehran and they said they didn't know I
spoke with some people I knew in
Washington and they also said that it
looks like it's not going to be
effective until April and they suggested
that we just go through and do the visa
waiver program which is called estar
online when you go and fill the form
they tell you that it takes them at most
72 hours to get back to you so we did it
on Friday and the flight was on Tuesday
so we assumed that that 72 hours would
be enough for them to make a decision
but they it's still pending even until
this moment that I'm talking to you on
their website it says that my request is
pending I phoned the embassy yesterday
morning a couple of hours before my
flight and I said I still haven't heard
from esta and they said Esther has
nothing to do with the embassy they gave
me a number they suggested that I should
go to the airport anyway because I had
bought tickets I went to the airport
hoping that by phoning Esther it can be
resolved over the phone in a few hours
and they on the phone I was told because
of the new legislations and my other
nationality which is Iranian I need to
apply from a visa and I have to go to
the US Embassy that's why I wasn't able
to check in and board that flight that
just to make clear you are a dual
national but you have a child who is
British does this feel right now that
you are being discriminated against
based on your heritage yes and I'm not
it's not just me there are many Iranians
who have been talking about it since
they began talking about this new
legislation because you think that
President Obama or all that these years
has said that he differentiates between
the people of Iran and the politicians
of Iran but these new legislations are
in fact addressing Iranian Nationals and
Iranian ordinary people and not only
them if you are born to an Iranian
father or you're a married to an Iranian
man not a woman of course you are
automatically can become an Iranian not
even in cases you haven't even set foot
in on the Iranian soil you have
not know anything about your own but in
order to go to the US you have to get a
visa and if you wanted to run I know you
don't but if you wanted to how easy is
it to renounce your Iranian heritage
passport citizenship it's extremely
difficult oh I'd say almost impossible
not that I want to I love being Iranian
as well but I the other thing I would
like to add is that is that it's not
just the Iranians this legislation means
that in all the citizens of the 38
countries who are under the visa waiver
program which means they didn't need
visas to visit the US if they visit any
of these four countries that you
mentioned for the four five years after
that they need to apply for a visa to go
to the US so they must be real worries
now and around about things like tourism
that people just won't want to be
bothered with the red tape
exactly and that's that's the bigger
picture and that's why many Iranians are
concerned because the Iranian tourism
industry has just recently recovered
from years of sanctions and they were
hoping that more European tourists can
bring more money and more prosperity in
the country some French companies are
building hotels but the new restrictions
means many European nations might think
twice before deciding to go to Iran
because then it means there will be more
hassles to go to the US after that
